item.title: My Awards
item.description:
International Awards and Prizes

  1. Peter Luh Young Researcher Award (Runner-up) for the paper “ Dynamic Causal Graph Convolutional Network for Traffic Prediction”, selected 3/600, highly prestigious, IEEE Robotics and Automation Society (2023).
  2. Best Paper Award (Runner-up) for the paper “ Graph-aware Tensor Topic Models for Individualized Passenger Travel Pattern Clustering”, Institute of Industrial and Systems Engineers (IISE), Quality Control and Reliability Engineering (QCRE) (2023).
  3. Best Student Paper Award (Finalist) for the paper “Tensor Completion for High-dimensional Data with Graph-structured and Weakly-dependent Sample Dimension”, IISE QCRE (2022).
  4. Best Applied Paper Award (Winner) for the paper “ Tensor Topic Models with Graphs and Applications on Individualized Travel Patterns” INFORMS Data Mining and Decision Analytics (DMDA) Workshop (2021).
  5. Best Theoretical Paper Award (Runner-Up) for the paper “ Low-Rank Robust Subspace Tensor Clustering for Metro Passenger Flow Modeling”, INFORMS DMDA (2021).
  6. Best Conference Paper Award (Winner) for the paper “ Long-Short Term Spatiotemporal Tensor Prediction for Passenger Flow Profile”, IEEE International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering (CASE) (2020): selected from 1/500, highly prestigious.
  7. Best Student Poster Award (Finalist) for the paper “ Profile Decomposition based Hybrid Transfer Learning for Cold-start Data Anomaly Detection”, INFORMS Quality, Statistics, and Reliability (QSR) Section (2020).
  8. Best Student Paper Award (Finalist) for the paper “ Individualized Passenger Travel Pattern Multi-Clustering based on Graph Regularized Tensor Latent Dirichlet Allocation”, INFORMS Data Mining (2020).
  9. Best Student Paper Award (Finalist) for the paper “ Tensor Completion for Weakly-Dependent Data on Graph for Metro Passenger Flow Prediction”, INFORMS QSR Section (2020).

Scholarships and Individual Funding

- Awards During Ph.D. and After Ph.D.

  1. ACM Young Researcher Travel Grant Award 2023 (Winner) Amount: 1,000 USD;
  • Funding Agency: ACM SIGSPATIAL (2023).
  1. Hong Kong Ph.D. Fellowship Scholarship Award (2017-2020) Amount: 1,296,000 HKD
  • Highly-selective and prestigious, only 2 recipients in the department.
  • Funding Agency: Hong Kong Research Grants Council
  1. Best Thesis Award 2021 (2nd Runners-up) Amount: 3,000 HKD
  • HKUST Three Minute Thesis Competition.
  1. 1st Runners-up, Audience Award, Hackathon@UST 2018 Amount: 15,000 HKD

- During Bachelor Study

  1. National First Prize, “Challenge Cup” National Curricular Academic Science and Technology Contest: A data-driven study for land transfer in rural China 2015
  2. Honored Graduate Award, Xi’an Jiaotong University 2017
  3. Regional First Prize, 7th Mechanical Innovation & Design Competition 2016
  4. National Scholarship, Xi’an Jiaotong University 2016
  5. 1st-Runners-up Award, XJTU Entrepreneurship Competition 2015
  6. National Encourage Scholarships, Xi’an Jiaotong University 2014, 2015

item.title: Walking Through The Time: All The News
item.description:
• June 2024: Our paper “ X-Light: Cross-City Traffic Signal Control Using Transformer on Transformer as Meta Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learner” is selected as the Highlight Paper in IJCAI 2024 in the track of AI for Critical Infrastructure.
  • June 2024: Our “ 2nd Workshop on Vision-based Industrial Inspection (VISION) at ECCV 2024” is officially online. Come and join our data challenge and CFP!
  • May 2024: Our paper “ CoSLight: Co-optimizing Collaborator Selection and Decision-making to Enhance Traffic Signal Control” is accepted to SIGKDD 2024! Great job, Jingqing.
  • May 2024: We presented two papers in ICLR 2024 (Vienna, Austria) of using Large Language Models (LLMs) as agents to solve complex tasks.
  • May 2024: We presented one paper in AISTATS 2024 (Valencia, Spain) of using contrastive learning to generate data for unsensored locations citywide!
  • April 2024: Our paper “ X-Light: Cross-City Traffic Signal Control Using Transformer on Transformer as Meta Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learner” is accepted to IJCAI 2024! Great job, Haoyuan.
  • April 2024: Me and my colleagues, Yizhou Wang (Northeastern University) and Kuan-Chuan Peng (Mitsubishi Electric Research Lab), are organizing a workshop “ Anomaly Detection with Foundation Models” in IJCAI 2024.
  • April 2024: Dr. Ziyue Li is featured as the highlighted member in Institute of Industrial and Systems Engineers.
  • Mar 2024: Our paper “ Controlling Large Language Model-based Agents for Large-Scale Decision-Making: An Actor-Critic Approach” is accepted to ICLR 2024! Great job, Bin.
  • Feb 2024: Our paper “ FELight: Fairness-Aware Traffic Signal Control via Sample-Efficient Reinforcement Learning” is accepted to IEEE TKDE! Great job, Xinqi.
  • Feb 2024: Our paper “ A General Scenario-Agnostic Reinforcement Learning for Traffic Signal Control” is accepted to IEEE TITS! Great job, Haoyuan.
  • Feb 2024: Our paper “ Low-Rank Robust Subspace Tensor Clustering for Metro Passenger Flow Modeling” is accepted to INFORMS Journal of Data Science! Great job, Jiuyun.
  • Nov 2023: One paper accepted to AISTATS 2024
  • Oct 2023: Two papers were accepted to ACM SIGSPATIAL 2023
  • Oct 2023: I started to teach the course “Advanced Data Analytics and Deep Learning” for Master Program
  • Oct 2023: I started to serve as the Sub-Council Member in INFORMS QSR
  • Oct 2023: I served as Chair in INFORMS Annual Meeting 2023 (Phoenix, Arizona). The two sessions were “Structure Learning from Heterogenous Data” and “Spatiotemporal Decision Intelligence”.
  • Aug 2023: I served as Chair in IEE CASE 2023 (Phoenix, Arizona), with theme in “Spatiotemporal Decision Intelligence”.
  • Aug 2023: I served as Chair in SIGKDD (Long Beach, CA), with theme in “Graph Neural Network”.
